abstract.p: Dr Nathaniel S Lehrman letter on June 14 article questions relabeling of bad habits as adult attention disorder

block.p: Relabeling bad habits as mental disorders is bad social policy and dangerous to society. ''Procrastination, impulsiveness, disorganization, hyperactivity, lack of motivation and an inability to manage time,'' you report (Workplace section, June 14), are the key symptoms of the ''biochemical imbalances in the brain'' now called adult attention disorder.

Relabeling bad habits as mental disorders is bad social policy and dangerous to society. ''Procrastination, impulsiveness, disorganization, hyperactivity, lack of motivation and an inability to manage time,'' you report (Workplace section, June 14), are the key symptoms of the ''biochemical imbalances in the brain'' now called adult attention disorder.

An entirely new class of counselors has suddenly arisen to treat this recent ''disorder.'' Will the parity now mandated for mental and physical illness require medical insurance reimbursement for treating these disorders, thus raising insurance costs for the rest of us?
And will a legion of adults now join the millions of youths already taking medications like Ritalin for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, and become newly dependent on drugs?
NATHANIEL S. LEHRMAN, M.D. Roslyn, N.Y., June 14, 2000
